topic_metadata.title: Why are font styles not being applied?

posts.name: dezifit
posts.cooked:
Why does the following example not show the correct font style, provided that all variants are installed?

#let font = { "Helvetica" }

#block(width:15cm)[*Typst version:* #sys.version \ \
#text(font: font, style: "normal", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)

#text(font: font, style: "oblique", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)]

#text(font: font, style: "italic", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)
posts.raw:
Why does the following example not show the correct font style, provided that all variants are installed?
```typ
#let font = { "Helvetica" }

#block(width:15cm)[*Typst version:* #sys.version \ \
#text(font: font, style: "normal", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)

#text(font: font, style: "oblique", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)]

#text(font: font, style: "italic", weight: "bold", size: 32pt,
	fill: rgb(0,0,0,0), stroke: 0.5pt + blue, font)
```
![result|227x294](upload://795umgVVaSiCvdiLTfmyNRuAWcC.jpeg)

posts.cooked:
They must be “incorrectly” installed? The same code on my typst 0.12 shows the correct styles.

You can execute typst fonts --variants to check which font styles typst has found on your system.
posts.raw:
They must be "incorrectly" installed? The same code on my typst 0.12 shows the correct styles.

You can execute `typst fonts --variants` to check which font styles typst has found on your system.

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
Hi @dezifit, thanks for your question! Could you maybe try to revise your post’s title so others can find it easier in the future? The question guidelines recommend a complete question:

Good titles are questions you would ask your friend about Typst.

Also, please add relevant tags such as fonts and move it to the Questions category (I’m actually not sure if you can change that yourself; if not, I can do it for you.
posts.raw:
Hi @dezifit, thanks for your question! Could you maybe try to revise your post’s title so others can find it easier in the future? The [question guidelines](https://forum.typst.app/t/how-to-post-in-the-questions-category/11) recommend a complete question:

Also, please add relevant tags such as #fonts::tag ~~and move it to the #questions category (I'm actually not sure if you can change that yourself; if not, I can do it for you.~~

posts.name: dezifit
posts.cooked:
sijo:

typst fonts --variants

Ok, for Helvetica this only lists:

Helvetica
- Style: Normal, Weight: 400, Stretch: FontStretch(1000)

and indeed, I had them in a LaTeX specific folder. After moving them to a system wide directory the output is as expected. Thanks for your help.
posts.raw:
[quote="sijo, post:2, topic:1351"]
`typst fonts --variants`
[/quote]

Ok, for Helvetica this only lists:
```
Helvetica
- Style: Normal, Weight: 400, Stretch: FontStretch(1000)
```
and indeed, I had them in a LaTeX specific folder. After moving them to a system wide directory the output is as expected. Thanks for your help.

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked: A note on “moving the fonts”. You probably don’t need to move the latex fonts to a system wide directory. A symbolic link works fine.
posts.raw: A note on "moving the fonts". You probably don't need to move the latex fonts to a system wide directory. A symbolic link works fine.

posts.cooked: Hey @dezifit, I’ve marked your reply as a solution as it appears you’ve solved the problem. Please mark solutions in the replies as well for future questions. Thanks!
posts.raw: Hey @dezifit, I've marked your reply as a solution as it appears you've solved the problem. Please mark solutions in the replies as well for future questions. Thanks!
